summary.p: The Kūrmapurāṇam is a Tamil version of the Sanskrit Kūrmapurāṇam by the Teṉkāci ("Southern Kāśī") king Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, who ruled in the second half of the 16th century. See Raghavan (1960, p. 228‒229). On Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, best known for his Naiṭatam, a Tamil version of the Sanskrit Naiṣadha by Harṣa, see Shulman (2012, pp. 155ff.).
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, invocation page, marginal title, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statement, in-text text completion statement, scribal colophon.

collation.desc: 1 folio = invocation. No foliation. Verso blank.
420 folios = mūlam. Tamil foliation 1‒277, 279-282, 284-422. Several foliations corrected. 5 to 8 lines per page.
4 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation. Some bore holes caused by insects.

additions.desc: A small paper leaf comes along with the bundle. Written in black ink: No. 117. கூர்மபுராணம்.

origin.origDate: 1774 according to Cabaton's interpretation (1912, p. 47) of the colophon date (U2, f422r6).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 47.
Raghavan, V. (1960). Tamil Versions of the Purāṇas. Purāṇa. 2(1–2): 225–242.

Rangacharya, M. & Kuppusvami Sastri, S. (1916). A Descriptive Catalogue of the Tamil Manuscripts in the Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras. Vol. 2: Itihāsa and Puṟāṇa, and Relgion and Philosophy (Vaiṣṇavism). Madras: Government Press.
Shulman, David (2012). More than Real: A History of the Imagination in South India. Cambridge [Ma]: Harvard University Press.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
